result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey A. Olson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department. Bond previously posted in the amount of $100 has been applied. The remaining court costs will be paid to the Taylor County Clerk of Courts Office in the amount of $100 a month beginning October 10, 2022. Failure to pay may result in a civil judgment being entered against you, tax intercept, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

Defendant shall write a letter of apology to Walmart due within 30 days of sentencing to be preapproved by the probation agent. Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by the probation agent. Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

ADDRESS INFO for Jeffrey A. Olson
Current: 2804 apt G 39th St, Two Rivers, WI 54241 United States  (Effective: 09-01-2022)
Prior: 331 N. Park Avenue, Medford, WI 54451

2:04 PM Defendant Jeffrey A. Olson appeared by video.  Attorney John P Runde in court for Jeffrey A. Olson.  Attorney Kristi S. Tlusty in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim notification has been complied. 
Attorney Tlusty moves to amend Count 1 in 21CM91 to disorderly conduct and dismiss the domestic abuse modifier. Plea agreement recited into the record. Defendant enters a plea of no contest in count 1 amended charge to disorderly conduct in 21CM91. Defendant enters a plea of no contest in count 2 of 22CM23. Plea colloquy. Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists for the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1 disorderly conduct in 21CM91 remaining counts are dismissed but read in. Court finds defendant guilty of count 2 retail theft in 22CM23. Court moves to dismiss and read in remaining counts and case 22CM40. Statement made by Attorney Tlusty. Statement made by Attorney Runde. Statement made by defendant. Court withholds sentence in amended count 1 21CM91 and count 2 of 22CM23 and orders probation for 1 year with the conditions of court costs for each count, DNA sample and surcharge on each count, restitution in the amount of $23.03 in 22CM23, a letter of apology to S.O. in 21CM91 and Walmart in 22CM23 due within 30 days of sentencing to be preapproved by the probation agent, counseling as deemed appropriate by the probation agent. Court orders the costs to be made to the Taylor County Clerks office in the amount of $100 a month starting October 10, 2022.

10:45 am - Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jeffrey A. Olson appeared in person, in custody.  Attorney Nick Smith appeared specially for the defendant by audio and video through Zoom.  Victim notification has been complied.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Attorney Tlusty is requesting a $250.00 cash bond; booking and for the clerk to begin bond revocation proceedings in 21CM91.  Statement by Attorney Smith requesting a signature bond.  Court orders a $100.00 cash bond and $500.00 signature bond and booking. Court orders the clerk to begin bond revocation proceedings in 21CM91. Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Initial appearance scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 1:00 pm.  - rt
